original_title: Sri Lanka-Canada Business Council hosts interactive evening with Canadian High Commissioner
original_body_lines: The Sri Lanka - Canada Business Council (SLCBC) of The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce hosted an interactive evening with Eric Walsh, High Commissioner of Canada to Sri Lanka and The Maldives.

Organised in collaboration with the High Commission of Canada to Sri Lanka and The Maldives, the event was attended by senior officials of the Government, members of the diplomatic corps and high profile business leaders amongst others, offering attendees the opportunity to network and discuss opportunities for bilateral collaboration.
The High Commissioner highlighted the importance of continued collaboration between Canada and Sri Lanka on various fronts such as trade, investment, tourism and environmental sustainability.

The evening featured a range of interactive activities designed to foster dialogue and learning. Attendees had the opportunity to ask questions of the High Commissioner, participate in group discussions and engage in activities that offered a glimpse into the world of Canada’s bilateral relations with Sri Lanka. The event also provided ample opportunities for networking and socialising.
The High Commission of Canada to Sri Lanka and The Maldives remains committed to promoting bilateral relations, cultural exchanges and people-to-people ties between Sri Lanka and Canada.

The event was sponsored by Ceyline Shipping Ltd., Universal College Lanka, SALOTA International Ltd., McLarens Holdings Ltd., Prima Ceylon Ltd., Spillburg Holdings, Asian Institute of Business & Science, Belden Industries Ltd., United Ventures Ltd., Lidechsi Ltd., Fab Foods Ltd. and Samson Rubber Products Ltd.
